comment:
* Common implementation of Context API, which provides the base
 * context object for Activity and other application components.

variables.name: sSharedPrefsCache
variables.comment: * Map from package name, to preference name, to cached preferences.

variables.name: mSharedPrefsPaths
variables.comment: * Map from preference name to generated path.

variables.name: mDisplay
variables.comment: may be null if invalid display or not initialized yet.

variables.name: mSplitName
variables.comment: The name of the split this Context is representing. May be null.

variables.name: mIsSystemOrSystemUiContext
variables.comment:
* Whether this is created from {@link #createSystemContext(ActivityThread)} or
     * {@link #createSystemUiContext(ContextImpl, int)} or any {@link Context} that system UI uses.

variables.name: mServiceCache
variables.comment: The system service cache for the system services that are cached per-ContextImpl.

variables.name: mServiceInitializationStateArray
variables.comment:
* Initialization state for each service. Any of {@link #STATE_UNINITIALIZED},
     * {@link #STATE_INITIALIZING} or {@link #STATE_READY},

private void warnIfCallingFromSystemProcess()
methods.comment:
* Logs a warning if the system process directly called a method such as
     * {@link #startService(Intent)} instead of {@link #startServiceAsUser(Intent, UserHandle)}.
     * The "AsUser" variants allow us to properly enforce the user's restrictions.

static ContextImpl createSystemUiContext(ContextImpl systemContext, int displayId)
methods.comment:
* System Context to be used for UI. This Context has resources that can be themed.
     * Make sure that the created system UI context shares the same LoadedApk as the system context.
     * @param systemContext The system context which created by
     *                      {@link #createSystemContext(ActivityThread)}.
     * @param displayId The ID of the display where the UI is shown.

methods.name: static ContextImpl createSystemUiContext(ContextImpl systemContext)
methods.comment:
* The overloaded method of {@link #createSystemUiContext(ContextImpl, int)}.
     * Uses {@Code Display.DEFAULT_DISPLAY} as the target display.
